This code contains analysis of data on marriage trends.
(Source data: Decennial Census (years 1960 to 2000) and American Community Survey (years 2001-2012), via IPUMS USA.) 

```{r}
#install.packages('rio')
library(rio)
setwd('/Users/tarunkhanna/Desktop/Collaborative Data Methods')
marriage <- import('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/fivethirtyeight/data/master/marriage/both_sexes.csv')
```

The proportion of men and women who never marry has been increasing in the US and has reached almost reached 50%

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data = marriage, mapping = aes(year, all_2534)) + geom_line()+xlab('year') + ylab('% people who never married')



```
